Oil prices fell further on Thursday as the Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries met in Vienna. OPEC and allied exporting countries ended the meeting without announcing a decision to cut crude output, and prepared to debate the matter the next day. content.title: UAE says Qatar's decision to leave OPEC admission of decline of Doha's role - Reuters
content.desc: The United Arab Emirates said on Monday Doha's decision to leave OPEC was a reflection of the decline of its influence. "The political aspect of Qatar's decision to quit OPEC is an admission of the decline of its role and influence in light of its political isolation," Anwar Gargash, UAE minister of state for foreign affairs, said in a tweet. content.desc: The outcome of this week’s Opec meeting in Vienna is uncertain. content.desc: Qatar plans to quit Opec from next year as relations with its Arab neighbours sour, ending a near six-decade-long membership of the oil price cartel.
